text: There is increasing evidence for an alternative genome/proteome in both prokaryotes and eukaryotes, reflecting programmed ribosomal frameshifting. It is likely that a combination of computational, experimental, genomic, and proteomic methods will be needed to determine the entire frameshifted proteome, as required to understand fully gene expression in any organism. We need to identify the frameshift motifs that enable frameshifting, as well as all the genes that produce out-of-frame peptides. Finally, as a low level of frameshifting can be considered
we need to determine the physiological relevance of these frameshifted proteins.
